meanings.sent1: After spinning around too fast, I felt woozy and had to sit down.
meanings.sent2: She felt woozy after riding the roller coaster multiple times.
meanings.sent3: The woozy feeling made her giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The swirling colors in the painting made me feel woozy.
meanings.sent5: The heat and lack of water left him woozy and disoriented.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel dizzy or lightheaded
meanings.sent1: The spinning teacup ride can woozy some people.
meanings.sent2: The strong medication can woozy patients if not taken with food.
meanings.sent3: He tried to woozy his friend by spinning him around in circles.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news seemed to woozy her mind.
meanings.sent5: The intense aroma of the flowers began to woozy her senses.
